commit_list.message:
Setup: make the code directory a sibbling of bearded-octo-batman

The main problem with the code directory being under the
bearded-octo-batman directory was that it meant that there was a
'parent' git repository for the projects which might have been
confusing.  Now the code dir sits alongside this project it's defo
separate - but now it's a bit more complicated to set up...
commit_list.repo_description: experimenting with dev setup

commit_list.message:
Provisioning: improve use of bash conditionals

 * use (( )) for numeric comparisons
 * don't put commands in [[ ]]
 * quote $variables in [[ ]]

also use ${somename} in preference to $somename

commit_list.message:
Vagrant: initial setup for docker based development

To see how using something like this for docker-based development on my
mac works.

The idea is for this to be at a top level and different docker-based
projects can live inside the code directory.  The idea is that they will
share this vagrant instance (so save spinning up new ones) and hence
will share the same docker image library (so I don't have to download
the base images for each project - they'll already be there...

Might work out or it might not.....
commit_list.repo_description: experimenting with dev setup

commit_list.message: update license
Add some documentation
Ensure users are cleared
Deal with unregistered users and wrong passwords
Check for registered users when bind-ing
Handle unregistered queries
Ensure query registrations can be cleared
Ensure response are returned with different instance of filters
Ensure an exception is raised if registered
Ensure registerred array responses are returned
ensure registererd hash responses are returned
Ensure unregisted queries are reported as being unregistered
Ensure queries that raise an exception can be registered
Ensure queries returning an array can be registered
Allow queries that return a hash to be registered
Initial commit

commit_list.message:
Merge branch 'timer'

* timer: (23 commits)
  Todo: more to do
  Timer: bugfix time display (was showing 00:60 for 59999
  Timer: show stopwatch whilst doing exercise
  Timer: show wpm on completion
  Timer: wpm calculation
  Timer: move the timer view into Stopwatch
  Timer: show the time taken on completion
  Timer: stop consuming characters when Exercise is complete
  Timer: track the time taken to type an exercise
  Timer: pass the time taken for each char to the Exercise
  Timer: Stopwatch.lastLap returns the last lap time
  Timer: lap the stopwatch when consuming a character
  Timer: pull out helper function to consume characters in Main.elm
  Timer: make lap timer autostart
  Timer: tick the stopwatch
  Timer: add a stopwatch to keep track of time
  Debug: remove model printout at foot of screen
  Timer: rename Stopwatch.elapsed -> Stopwatch.time
  Timer: add lap timer functionality
  Timer: add a basic Stopwatch
  ...
commit_list.repo_description: example elm app - might even use it to improve my typing...

Revert "Ruby: rvm install should be part of system provisioning"

This reverts commit e4c33c032b4b13429e9c7813d75bd314466317d9.

as it show not be part of provisioning - the idea is for it to be done
as a single user install which puts it in the user's ~/.rvm directory.
